main event: A civilian observer reported seeing a white object larger than the morning star drifting slowly from the East to Southeast for over an hour.
interesting points: The observation lasted for one hour and twelve minutes.,The object was observed using binoculars at one point.,The object could not be positively identified as a balloon.,Factors like wind and proximity to weather balloon release points were considered.,The conclusion of the sighting was marked as possibly a weather balloon or aircraft, but was unresolved.
sighted object: one white object larger than the morning star
